TopicTitle: BobCat Ind. - Colonization, exploring and research vehicle

Articles.Content:
Wow so much details. What do I say? Functional details!

That's great BobCat!
This is ingenious!
So... I'm a sucker for new capsules/rovers/sciency-looking-vehicles and by god yours takes the cake. Loving the realistic approach your taking of including a landing pod for the exploratory rover.

Does this imply that it's going to have a "proper" interior?

Bobcat is struggling mightily to get a functioning interior. There is so little information available, we are having a very difficult time getting it to work.

Bobcat is struggling mightily to get a functioning interior. There is so little information available, we are having a very difficult time getting it to work.

i have got a tutarial here

Bobcat is struggling mightily to get a functioning interior. There is so little information available, we are having a very difficult time getting it to work.

Well, this is a pretty good tutorial i saw popping up a few moments ago, the good thing is that it actually includes an example:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/23030-0-17-interior-tutorial-download-example-project

Otherwise there's this one might actually be better, but i still reccomend checking both out : http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/entry.php/187-0-17-internals-tutarial.

Otherwise, can't you just use the MK1 spaceplane pods interior temporarily?

Unfortunately all of the tutorials leave out important pieces of info, but we're getting closer. The existing interiors can be used but they are one or three kerbals side by side configurations and the Mk4 is a two kerbal tandem cockpit craft.

We're still working on it, but it's definitely slowing down the release.

i have got a tutarial here

Yes, thank you. We saw that.

Maybe... or not. Im not coder

I was just watching the RAT Drop Capsule video where it lands by parachute.

Will there be optional engines for landing in a vacuum?

I was just watching the RAT Drop Capsule video where it lands by parachute.

Will there be optional engines for landing in a vacuum?

Maybe, If the standard for this part does not fit. Drop module is designed to fit into any environment

i think it is posible to make your own instuments. they wurk like any other part so i gues you can just add a module. i am also going tomake my own instrument, not sure what, there is a poll on my thread
Can you say,when Rat will be released?
Once all the tests will be
